channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [CXF-8254] NPE in WebFaultOutInterceptor handleMessage method
item.description:
When sending a soap request to a nonexisting endpoint (e.g. due to typo), the WebFaultOutInterceptor can throw a NullPointerException under certain circumstances.

If the content-type of the request misses the soap action, the WebFaultOutInterceptor produces the NPE in line 163 since BindingOperationInfo is null.

Content-Type: application/soap+xml;charset=UTF-8

OperationInfo op = message.getExchange().getBindingOperationInfo().getOperationInfo();

Stacktrace:

2020-04-01 09:13:45.465  WARN [MycompanyApplication] 1180 --- [nio-5100-exec-1] o.a.cxf.phase.PhaseInterceptorChain      : Interceptor for {http://ws.mycompanydomain.de/}WebService has thrown exception, unwinding now

org.apache.cxf.interceptor.Fault: Message part {http://ws.mycompanydomain.de/WebService/v1.0}WebMethodWithTypo was not recognized.  (Does it exist in service WSDL?)

If the content-type of the request contains the soap action, everything works fine

Content-Type: application/soap+xml;charset=UTF-8;action="http://ws.mycompanydomain.de/WebService/v1.0#WebMethod"

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Do you have a test-case that reproduces the issue?

I have created a repository on github with which you can reproduce the NPE.

https://github.com/sandra-markerud/cxf-bug-example

It contains a spring boot web service and a SoapUI project with the tampered request.

To reproduce the NPE one needs to have the following prerequisites:

  • Send a SOAP request to a non existing endpoint (typo)
  • The content-type header must not include the soap action
  • A custom OutFaultInterceptor that converts all unhandled exceptions in a custom business exception which contains a @WebFault error object

I hope this helps.

Thank you in advance.
Thanks for the test-case, it should be fixed now. If you could confirm that would be great!
Would love to, but unfortunatelly, I can't reach the FishEye server to review the commits. There seems to be a server problem.

Thanks for the link. I could verify that the NPW is fixed!

Thank you!
